Formally, graph rewrites can be expressed using operators (Mjolsness 2019):
Example of how Graph Rewrites in DGGML Work and Operator Semantics
Category theoretic approaches can be found in (Lowe, 1993) and (Ehrig et al., 1973)
Formally, graph rewrites can be expressed using operators (Mjolsness 2019):
When reading from right to left:
all vertices and vertex labels of the LHS graph are annihilated (destroyed) in an arbitrary order.
Next all edges are annihilated in any order, then all vertices and vertex labels of the RHS graph are created in any order.
After, all edges of the RHS are created in any order.
The final operators on the first line are the dangling edge erasure operators that enforce that edges must connect active vertices.
Example of how Graph Rewrites in DGGML Work and Operator Semantics
